info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 4:57PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHERN KENTON, CENTRAL CAMPBELL, SOUTHEASTERN HAMILTON AND WEST CENTRAL CLERMONT COUNTIES THROUGH 530 PM EDT... At 456 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located over Highland Heights, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Cincinnati, Covington, Fort Thomas, Newport, Alexandria, Fort Mitchell, Highland Heights, Milford, Taylor Mill, Bellevue, Fort Wright, Dayton, Ludlow, Southgate, Park Hills, Claryville, Forestville, Amelia, Mariemont and Wilder. This includes the following Interstates... I-71 in Ohio between mile markers 0 and 2. I-75 in Kentucky between mile markers 189 and 191. I-75 in Ohio near mile marker 0. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for northern Kentucky...and southwestern Ohio. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
